alert.note: Alert for Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 03 at 7:24PM CDT until October 03 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Nolan County in west central Texas... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 724 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Loraine, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Roscoe and Champion around 730 PM CDT. Sweetwater around 745 PM CDT. Nolan around 815 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Us- 84 Near The Nolan-Fisher County Line, I-20 Near The Nolan- Mitchell County Line, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, Lake Sweetwater, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147, and Camp Boothe Oaks. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 260. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
